description_txt: stated on April 12, 2014 in a speech at the New Hampshire Freedom Summit:
quote_txt: "Eighty percent of Wall Street executives and their spouses' donations go to Democrats."

description_txt: stated on April 16, 2014 in comments on CNN:
quote_txt: "The U.S. spends more money on its military than the 16 biggest military budgets in the world" combined.

description_txt: stated on April 8, 2014 in the Civil Rights Summit at the Lyndon B. Johnson Presidential Library:
quote_txt: Every one of "more than 30 federal judges who have considered the issue of gay and lesbian rights since last June… ruled that marriage is a constitutional right and you cannot deprive individual citizens of that right based on their sexual orientation."

description_txt: stated on April 12, 2014 in a speech to the Freedom Summit in New Hampshire:
quote_txt: A recent Gallup poll found that 72 percent of Americans and 56 percent of Democrats "say the biggest threat to our nation's security is big government."

description_txt: stated on March 7, 2014 in an interview:
quote_txt: "The big Wall Street banks, the big corporations" give "many times more" political donations to Democrats than Republicans.

description_txt: stated on March 30, 2014 in a news story:
quote_txt: More "25- to 34-year-olds are moving to Austin than any other city in America."

description_txt: stated on April 3, 2014 in a broadcast of "Vocal Point":
quote_txt: "A lot of the move to free the slaves ... did not come from the federal government. It came from a growing movement among the people, particularly people of faith."

description_txt: stated on April 15, 2014 in in a comment on Twitter:
quote_txt: Americans spend "6.1 billion hours a year" on tax preparation.

description_txt: stated on March 30, 2014 in a campaign mailer:
quote_txt: Says Charlie Crist "implemented Jeb Bush’s A+ Plan."

description_txt: stated on March 31, 2014 in an interview on Fox News:
quote_txt: Says Mark Udall "decided Obamacare. ... He passed Obamacare with his vote."

description_txt: stated on April 14, 2014 in a campaign website:
quote_txt: In Rhode Island, "Nearly 9 percent of covered employees go out on short term disability every year, with an average outage from work of almost 12 weeks each."

description_txt: stated on April 7, 2014 in department blog post:
quote_txt: "Georgia has the nation's fifth largest Women, Infants and Children (WIC) Supplemental Nutrition program, serving more than 270,000 mothers, babies and children every day."

description_txt: stated on March 24, 2014 in a web video:
quote_txt: "Shaheen votes with Obama 99 percent of the time."

description_txt: stated on March 25, 2014 in congressional testimony.:
quote_txt: "From 1972 until 2011, the number of EPA employees increased by 107 percent while the number of total federal personnel decreased by 15 percent."

description_txt: stated on April 8, 2014 in remarks at a committee hearing:
quote_txt: "My state of Florida is now the third-largest state. We have surpassed New York in population."

description_txt: stated on April 10, 2014 in speech at the Lyndon B. Johnson Library:
quote_txt: During Lyndon B. Johnson’s first 20 years in Congress, "he opposed every civil rights measure that came up for a vote."

description_txt: stated on April 7, 2014 in an email:
quote_txt: Seventy-two percent of Georgians did not have a chance to finish college.

description_txt: stated on March 11, 2014 in a video:
quote_txt: "The Capitol rotunda was actually made to invite the people in and to accommodate protests."

description_txt: stated on April 13, 2014 in comments on ABC's "This Week":
quote_txt: The insurance risk corridors aren't going broke like Republicans predicted.

description_txt: stated on April 13, 2014 in comments on ABC's "This Week":
quote_txt: Obamacare is "costing 2 million jobs."

description_txt: stated on April 5, 2014 in a campaign email:
quote_txt: Says Gov. Scott Walker’s repeal of a 2009 law has left Wisconsin as "one of five states without an equal pay law protecting women from gender discrimination in their paycheck."

description_txt: stated on April 2, 2014 in a commentary in The Providence Journal:
quote_txt: "A grant for $5,000 [from the Governor’s Workforce Board] went to teach an employee at a company that makes ornamental business card holders how to use Facebook and Twitter."

description_txt: stated on April 2, 2014 in an op-ed.:
quote_txt: Federal money for Medicaid expansion "is guaranteed for a few years and then goes away."

quote_txt: "In 2006, Charlie Crist opposed in-state tuition for illegal immigrants."

description_txt: stated on April 9, 2014 in campaign web site:

description_txt: stated on April 8, 2014 in a news release:
quote_txt: "Women in Oregon are paid 79 cents for every dollar paid to men. If the wage gap was eliminated, a working woman in Oregon would have enough money for 2,877 gallons of gas, 72 more weeks of food for her family or nearly 12 more months of rent."

description_txt: stated on April 2, 2014 in a Facebook meme:
quote_txt: Says Rep. Michele Bachmann said President Barack Obama might be to blame for the Fort Hood shootings.

description_txt: stated on April 6, 2014 in a panel on "Meet the Press":
